page.title: 19FRILSHAM-SUPERNATURAL MYTHS
page.content: The church at Frilsham is dedicated to {St Frideswide or Fredeswitha}who was born in Oxford in the 8th century. Her father was a Saxon prince. From a child she devoted herself to the sick and poor. Her father bought a religous house for her at Oxford. To escape the attentions of Algar a noble, she lived in the forest in a swineherds hut eventually returning to Oxford where she died. Her relics are a shrine in Christchurch. Her day is October 19th. Many miracles are attributed to her{especially cures for blindness. On Frilsham Common there is a well with very old holly trees around it. Legend has it that Frideswide had a cell here and blessed the well. It never runs dry and the water is said to have healing properties. There is a {window of her in Frilsham Church showing a swinehut and Faircross well.
